visual_elements.description: Diagram A: Flag lot showing rear yard, interior side yards, front yard, street, with front lot line closest and most parallel to street. Front setback is 10' instead of 20'. Required setbacks and buildable area are indicated.
Diagram B: Corner lot showing rear yard, interior side yard, street side yard, front yard, street. Street side setback is 16'.

Diagram C: Substandard corner lot with frontage less than 50 feet. Shows rear yard, interior side yard, street side yard with 10' setback instead of 16', front yard, street. Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages.
Diagram D: Through lot showing rear yard, interior side yards, front yard, street.

Diagram E: Wedge shaped lot with curved front yard and no rear lot lines. Rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines. Shows rear yard, interior side yards, front yard, street.
Diagram F: Lot with more than 4 sides showing rear yard, interior side yards, front yard, street. Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street.
Diagram G: Lot with more than 4 sides showing rear yard, interior side yards, front yard, street.

technical_specifications.parameter: Standard front setback for Flag lot
Street side setback for Corner lot
Street side setback for Substandard Corner lot
Rear yard determination radius for Wedge shaped lot

structural_elements.main_heading: Determining setbacks on oddly shaped lots considerations
sections: Fig 17 Setbacks for oddly shaped lots

additional_notes: Page number 23 at bottom right corner
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected
All diagrams use consistent symbology with key provided
Text and diagrams are clear and legible

qualifiers.text: Front lot line is closest and most parallel to street.
Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages.
Wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines.

conditions.text: Street side setback is 10' instead of 16'
Rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines.
Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street.
conditions.threshold_value: farthest and most parallel to street

logical_relationships.expression: If front lot line is closest and most parallel to street (q1), then front setback is 10' instead of 20' (c1).
If front lot line is shortest of the two frontages (q2) and frontage < 50' (c4), then street side setback is 10' instead of 16' (c3).
If wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines (q3), then rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines (c5).

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if front lot line is closest and most parallel to street
If step 1 true, apply front setback of 10' instead of 20'
Evaluate if front lot line is shortest of two frontages and frontage < 50'
If step 3 true, apply street side setback of 10' instead of 16'
Evaluate if lot is wedge shaped and has no rear lot lines
If step 5 true, determine rear yard by 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines
